pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [24c7cf77a0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21683/commits/24c7cf77a02b7711d12a3c030cb05bff0f737c39)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +2.11% | `Mathlib.Order.Filter.AtTopBot.Finset` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Order.Filter.AtTopBot.Finset | 522 | 533 | +11 (+2.11%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Order.Filter.AtTopBot.Finset`|11|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ HasProd.sum`
`+ Multipliable.sum`
`+ sumEquiv_symm_apply`
`+ tendsto_toLeft_atTop`
`+ tendsto_toRight_atTop`
`+ tprod_finsetProd`
`+ tprod_sum`
`++ sumEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Judging from the "Import changes for all files" tab, the import increase should be fine.

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13311865024/job/37176186729)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13311865024/job/37176187159)
bors d+
Can you add the `Set` version of this as well?

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma atTop_map_sumEquiv : atTop.map (Finset.sumEquiv ( := ) ( := )) = atTop :=
```
Can't simps give you this one automatically?
No it gives `RelEquiv.symm sumEquiv s = _` because `OrderEquiv` is a type synonym.
Oh, that's sad, I wonder if we can adjust the simps setup here to make it work...
nice to see these defs getting some love already!
IMO it's nicer to do this by breaking h1 and h2 into HasProd rather than choice, but I won't insist on it.
Is this what you were thinking of?
Yup!
Can we have the tprod version of this too?
it looks to me like tprod_sum might be a closer name to the others in this file, is that available?
Yes but the additive version `tsum_sum` is not.

Hmm, that one's part of a pair tprod_of_prod / tsum_sum, which doesn't quite make sense. I'd say both of those should mention finset somehow, since they're about Finset.prod and Finset.sum, whereas these ones don't.
Does `tsum_sum` still exist? If not, please add a deprecation for it as well.
Yes. It became the new lemma about `tsum` on sum types. I added a comment there to try to point people to the renamed lemma.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `HasProd` on sum types
